item.title: 中国机器人出租车初创企业 Pony AI 在美国上市融资 2.6 亿美元
item.description: 中国机器人出租车公司 Pony AI 周三表示，该公司在美国的首次公开募股已募集到 2.6 亿美元，其美国存托股票的定价为每股 13 美元。【原文：China-based robotaxi company Pony AI said on Wednesday it had raised $260 million in its U.S. initial public offering, pricing its American depositary shares at $13 each.】

item.title: 摩根大通因美国经济增长上调墨西哥股票评级，下调巴西股票评级
item.description: 由于美国经济增长强劲，摩根大通将墨西哥股票评级从 "中性 "上调至 "增持"，但下调了巴西股票评级，理由是中国经济增长放缓，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策带来新的压力。【原文：JPMorgan upgraded Mexican equities to "overweight" from "neutral" on the back of strong U.S. growth, but cut Brazilian equities citing slower growth in China amid emerging pressures from President-elect Donald Trump's tariff policy.】

item.title: 阿联酋航空称波音延误 "折断了翅膀
item.description: 阿联酋航空公司总裁周三表示，由于缺乏飞机，该公司是一个 "沮丧的实体"，并补充说，如果飞机制造商能够按时交付波音 777-9X 飞机，该公司现在将拥有一支由 85 架飞机组成的机队。【原文：Emirates Airline is a "frustrated entity" because of a lack of planes, the carrier's president said on Wednesday, adding that it would now have an 85-strong fleet of Boeing 777-9X jets if the planemaker had been able to deliver them on time.】

item.title: GfK 报告显示，因担心裁员，12 月德国消费者情绪下滑
item.description: 周三的一项调查显示，德国消费者信心指数预计将在今年最后一个月下滑，打破连续增长的势头，因为面对裁员的报道，家庭对收入前景更加悲观。【原文：German consumer sentiment is expected to tumble in the last month of the year, breaking a streak of increases as households, confronted by reports of job cuts, grow more pessimistic about their income prospects, a survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 如果特朗普征收关税，亚洲可能受益于更便宜的加拿大和墨西哥石油
item.description: 交易商和分析师表示，如果美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普对从加拿大和墨西哥进口的原油征收25%的进口关税，那么这两个国家的石油生产商将可能被迫降低价格，并将供应转向亚洲。【原文：Oil producers in Canada and Mexico will likely be forced to reduce prices and divert supply to Asia if U.S. President-elect Donald Trump imposes 25% import tariffs on crude imports from the two countries, traders and analysts said.】

item.title: 数据显示，10月份外国智能手机在华销量下降44.25
item.description: 据一家政府下属研究公司周三公布的数据，包括苹果公司 iPhone 在内的外国品牌智能手机 10 月份在中国的销量同比下降了 44.25%。【原文：Sales of foreign-branded smartphones, including Apple Inc's iPhone, in China fell 44.25% in October year-on-year, according to data released on Wednesday from a government-affiliated research firm.】

item.title: 澳大利亚出台法案，对超市不当行为处以巨额罚款
item.description: 澳大利亚政府周三向议会提交了一项法案，该法案将对未能遵守确保不虐待供应商的行业行为准则的大型连锁超市处以可能高达数十亿美元的罚款。【原文：The Australian government on Wednesday introduced a bill into parliament that would impose potentially billion-dollar fines on big supermarket chains that fail to comply with an industry code of conduct ensuring they do not mistreat suppliers.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，大众汽车将退出新疆业务，出售当地工厂和试车场
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士周三表示，大众汽车将退出其在中国新疆地区备受争议的工厂，此前大众汽车及其中国合作伙伴同意将该资产出售给一家上海政府所有的买家。【原文：Volkswagen will exit its controversial plant in China's Xinjiang region after it and its Chinese partner agreed to sell the asset to a Shanghai government-owned buyer, two people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿达尼绿色公司称，高塔姆-阿达尼因违反证券法面临指控
item.description: 阿达尼绿色能源公司（Adani Green Energy）周三表示，印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌违反证券法而在美国受到指控，并可能面临罚款，但并未受到美国《反海外腐败法》（Foreign Corrupt Practices Act）的指控。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani has been charged in the United States for alleged securities law violations and faces potential fines but has not been charged under the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, Adani Green Energy said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 黑色星期五：与特姆和谢因的竞标战中，网络营销成本飙升
item.description: 市场营销和行业专家称，特姆优和Shein在网络营销上的大手笔支出，使其他零售商和品牌在黑色星期五接触购物者的成本更高，这两个平台都在竞相大量购买竞争对手使用的搜索关键词。【原文：Heavy online marketing spending by Temu and Shein is making it more costly for other retailers and brands to reach shoppers on Black Friday, marketing and industry experts say, with both platforms bidding heavily on search keywords used by competitors.】

item.title: 尽管美国股市涨势汹涌，投资者仍坚守股灾保护措施
item.description: 尽管大选后美国股市大涨，创下历史新高，但针对股市暴跌的期权保护需求却在上升。【原文：Demand for options protection against an equity market crash is rising, even as a post-election rally takes U.S. stocks to record highs.】

item.title: 欧元贬值令全球投资者惶恐不安
item.description: 欧元将迎来自 2022 年初以来最糟糕的一个月，分析师警告说，继 8 月份日本日元汇率波动引发跨资产动荡之后，欧元的狂飙突进可能成为全球市场波动的下一个源头。【原文：As the euro heads for its worst month since early 2022, analysts warn that a wild ride in the currency could be the next source of global market volatility after gyrations in Japan's yen sparked a bout of cross-asset turmoil in August.】

item.title: 独家报道中国合赛明年将把激光雷达价格减半，预计将在电动汽车中广泛应用
item.description: 中国合赛集团是全球最大的自动驾驶激光雷达传感器制造商，该公司表示，计划明年将其关键产品的价格降低一半，这将促使电动汽车更广泛地采用该技术。【原文：China's Hesai Group , the world's largest maker of lidar sensors for autonomous driving, said it plans to slash the price of its key product by half next year which should lead to far wider adoption of the technology in electric cars.】

item.title: 印度议会因美国对阿达尼公司的指控再次停摆
item.description: 周三，印度议会下议院在议员要求讨论美国对港口发电企业阿达尼集团（Adani Group）的贿赂和欺诈指控的干扰下，第二天暂停议事。【原文：India's lower house of parliament suspended proceedings for a second day on Wednesday after disruption by lawmakers calling for a discussion of U.S. accusations of bribery and fraud against the ports-to-power Adani Group.】

item.title: 早间竞标特朗普关税威胁在亚洲引起反响
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，OpenAI 允许员工向软银出售价值 15 亿美元的股票
item.description: 据CNBC周三报道，微软支持的OpenAI公司允许其员工向日本软银集团（SoftBank Group）出售价值约15亿美元的股票。【原文：Microsoft-backed OpenAI is allowing its employees to sell roughly $1.5 billion worth of shares in a new tender offer to Japan's SoftBank Group , CNBC reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国比亚迪为供应商设定可协商的降价目标
item.description: 比亚迪一位高管在社交媒体平台微博上发布的帖子显示，中国汽车制造商比亚迪为大规模采购的供应商设定了可协商的降价目标。【原文：Chinese automaker BYD has set negotiable price reduction targets for suppliers of large-scale purchases, a BYD executive's post on social media platform Weibo shows.】

item.title: 鸟击后 FAA 将不要求立即对 737 MAX 发动机采取行动
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周二表示，在西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）的飞机于 2023 年发生两起鸟击事件后，美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）在召集了一个审查委员会审议对波音 737 MAX 发动机的担忧后，不会要求立即采取任何行动。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration said on Tuesday it will not require any immediate action after convening a review board to consider concerns about Boeing 737 MAX engines after two bird strike incidents on Southwest Airlines planes in 2023.】

item.title: 特朗普关税忧虑引发亚洲股市疲软；日元坚挺
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普承诺对加拿大、墨西哥和中国征收新关税一天后，投资者对即将上任的美国总统特朗普可能会对哪些国家征收关税感到担忧，亚洲股市周三大幅下挫。【原文：Asian stocks were heavy on Wednesday as investors fretted over what countries could be targeted for tariffs under incoming U.S. President Donald Trump, a day after he pledged new levies on Canada, Mexico and China.】

item.title: 台湾富士康称全球制造业布局使其免受特朗普关税影响
item.description: 台湾富士康周三表示，预计美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普征收新关税的影响将小于其竞争对手，理由是富士康的生产足迹遍布全球。【原文：Taiwan’s Foxconn said on Wednesday it expects any impact of new tariffs from U.S. President-elect Donald Trump to hit it less than its rivals, citing its global manufacturing footprint.】

item.title: 越南总理希望美国承认越南的市场经济地位
item.description: 越南总理范明正周三在一次商业峰会上表示，他希望美国承认越南为市场经济国家，并指出其他 70 多个国家已经承认越南为市场经济国家。【原文：Vietnam's Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh told a business summit on Wednesday that he hoped the United States would recognise Vietnam as a market economy, noting that more than 70 other countries already did.】

item.title: 现代汽车将回购价值 7.16 亿美元的股票
item.description: 现代汽车在周三提交的一份监管文件中称，该公司将从周四开始回购价值 1 万亿韩元（7.1579 亿美元）的股票，为期三个月。【原文：Hyundai Motor will buy back 1 trillion won ($715.79 million) worth of shares starting on Thursday over three months, the company said in a regulatory filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国 10 月工业利润降幅收窄，但需求依然疲软
item.description: 周三的官方数据显示，受上年同期基数较低的影响，中国 10 月份工业利润降幅收窄，但由于经济仍在与需求疲软和通货紧缩压力作斗争，盈利方面的不利因素依然严峻。【原文：China's October industrial profits narrowed their earlier declines, helped by a low base the previous year, official data showed on Wednesday, but headwinds on earnings remain stiff with the economy still battling weak demand and deflation pressures.】

item.title: 关注以色列-真主党停火和欧佩克+政策，油价保持稳定
item.description: 周三早盘，油价趋于稳定，市场正在评估以色列与真主党之间达成停火协议的潜在影响，并将于周日召开欧佩克+会议。【原文：Oil prices steadied in early trade on Wednesday, with markets assessing the potential impact of a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hezbollah, and ahead of Sunday's OPEC+ meeting.】

item.title: 中国国营媒体驳斥特朗普关税誓言，关注芬太尼问题
item.description: 周二晚些时候，中国国家媒体在社论中对美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普承诺对中国商品征收额外关税撇清责任，指责这位前总统将中国未能解决芬太尼危机归咎于中国。【原文：China's state media shrugged off U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's pledge to slap additional tariffs on Chinese goods in editorials late on Tuesday, accusing the former president of blaming China for the country's failure to address the fentanyl crisis.】

item.title: 新西兰将现金利率下调 50 个基点，进一步放宽政策
item.description: 新西兰央行周三将现金利率下调50个基点至4.25%，原因是年通胀率接近其目标区间2%的中点，且经济活动依然低迷。【原文：New Zealand's central bank cut the cash rate by 50 basis points to 4.25% on Wednesday, as annual inflation ran near the 2% midpoint of its target range and economic activity remained subdued.】

item.title: 独家：中国恒大投资者慎重抗议，要求采取行动
item.description: 据知情人士透露，数百名在中国恒大倒闭事件中损失了积蓄的中国投资者本月发起了一场协调运动，要求当局提供这家倒闭房地产开发商的最新情况。【原文：Hundreds of Chinese investors who lost savings in the collapse of China Evergrande launched a coordinated campaign this month to press authorities for an update on the failed property developer, according to people with knowledge of the effort.】

item.title: 主要货币盘整，市场在美国通胀数据公布前重整旗鼓
item.description: 周三，美元兑主要货币汇率持稳，投资者继续评估当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税承诺，同时关注当天晚些时候公布的美国关键通胀数据。【原文：The U.S. dollar steadied against major peers on Wednesday as investors continued to take stock of President-elect Donald Trump's tariff pledges, while keeping an eye on a key inflation figure out of the U.S. later in the day.】

item.title: 特朗普提议的关税可能如何影响大宗商品和能源
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周一承诺对美国的三大贸易伙伴--加拿大、墨西哥和中国--征收关税。拟议的关税将影响包括石油、天然气、农业和制造业在内的众多行业，有可能改变长期以来形成的贸易模式和供应链。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump on Monday pledged tariffs on the United States' three largest trading partners - Canada, Mexico and China. The proposed tariffs would affect a wide range of industries, including oil, natural gas, agriculture and manufacturing, potentially altering long-established trade patterns and supply chains.】

item.title: 李在镕董事长面对 "危机"，三星电子更换芯片主管
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）周三任命了新的领导人，试图为其存储器和代工芯片部门注入动力，因为该公司正努力在蓬勃发展的人工智能芯片市场上追赶 SK 海力士（Hynix）和台湾台积电（TSMC）。【原文：Samsung Electronics sought to inject impetus into its memory and foundry chip units by appointing new leaders on Wednesday, as it scrambles to catch SK Hynix and Taiwan's TSMC in the booming AI chip market.】
